The article published on Forbes on Sept: 8, 2016, which stated that in 2015, 2,988 people were shot in Chicago and the figure for 2016 stood at 2,949.
Data from the Chicago Tribune: s Crime in Chicagoland project, which supported the shooting count for 2015 and reported 3,210 shooting victims from Jan. 1 to Sept. 26, 2016.
Data released by the Chicago Police Depa: which showed 2,521 shooting incidents in the city up to Sept. 18, 2016.
